descriptions.Actinic Keratosis: Actinic keratosis is a rough, scaly patch on the skin caused by years of sun exposure. It can potentially develop into skin cancer if left untreated.
descriptions.Eczema: Eczema is a chronic skin condition characterized by dry, itchy, and inflamed skin. It can be triggered by various factors, including allergies and irritants.
descriptions.Nail Fungus: Nail fungus, also known as onychomycosis, is a common condition that affects the nails. It causes the nails to become thickened, discolored, and brittle.
descriptions.Psoriasis: Psoriasis is a chronic autoimmune disease that causes the rapid buildup of skin cells, resulting in red, scaly patches. It can affect various parts of the body.
descriptions.Seborrheic Keratosis: Seborrheic keratosis is a common benign skin growth that appears as a waxy, raised, and often dark or wart-like lesion. It is typically harmless.
descriptions.Fungal Infections: Fungal infections of the skin, such as ringworm and candidiasis, are caused by various types of fungi. They can cause itching, redness, and discomfort.
descriptions.Viral Infections: Viral infections of the skin, including warts and molluscum contagiosum, are caused by different types of viruses. They often result in skin growths or lesions.
